column1: millie j. ""betty"" fisher| millie j. ""betty"" fisher. born: may 14
column7: 2015 at her home in portage township. she was born may 14
column9: michigan the daughter of william and lillian (stamper) lawson and attended the gould city school. she was a graduate of the gould city high school with the class of 1950. on may 2
column10: 1951 the former millie j. lawson married willard e. fisher at the community church in curtis. they made their home and raised their family in curtis. he preceded her on may 3
column14: and grandmother. she was a member of the curtis baptist church
column15: spending over 30 years as a junior church leader. she loved traveling throughout the united states
column16: but most importantly she loved jesus
column19: and her church family. spending time with her family and friends was something betty thoroughly enjoyed. family
column21: and church meant the world to betty. she will be forever missed. betty is survived by her children
column27: timothy fisher of curtis and barry (michelle) fisher of curtis; 11 grandchildren; 13 great grandchildren; brothers
column28: richard (marion) owen of curtis and gary (carol) owen of imlay
column30: arbutus long of curtis and joan (george) bader of romeo
column32: susan pann and sally jack; sister-in-law
column34: byron leveille; along with many loved nieces and nephews. she was preceded in death by her parents
column35: william lawson and lillian lawson-owen; her husband
column38: ruby (kenneth) gehrett and georgia leveille; two infant brothers
column39: william joseph lawson and joseph william lawson; and her niece
column40: shirley gehrett. visitation will be held from 12:00 noon 1:00 pm
column43: 2015 at the curtis baptist church in curtis
column44: michigan. funeral services will follow at 1:00 pm at the church with reverend ray white officiating. burial will follow in the woodlawn cemetery at curtis
column47: 20151:00 pmcurtis baptist church main street curtis
